result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:41 AM Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Joseph Charles Blackdeer.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:12 AM Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in court, with Atty Alysja Otten.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case (22CM36, 22CM08, 22CF43) and recites appearances.  Atty Otten acknowledges information, waives reading, enters NG Plea on behalf of DEF.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. Court sets STC for 9/6/22 at 11AM.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:22 PM Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Otten indicates DEF  waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: COMBINED BOND  22CM36 and 22CF43

VOLUNTARY APPEARANCE
Uploaded and processed document from Sharefile, pulled card (sent to Sheriff's Dept).
Canceled warrant with Dispatch via message - Deputy Ripczinski #388  3/2/2022  @ 11:18 AM  verified by Deputy Sulley #383

11:14 AM Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer in court with attorney Alysja Otten appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case, recites appearances, and reviews court record.  Warrant quashed.   Attny Otten makes statement as to missed appearance.   State request bond to be reinstated.   Court reinstate SIBS bond $2500.     DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to all Counts.   Through counsel DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, but request to set for preliminary hearing.    Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Voluntary appearance/Initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Uploaded and processed document to Sharefile, sent paper copy to dispatch, printed warrant card.
Bail/Bond Review on April 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.

8:56  AM Defendant Joseph Charles Blackdeer not in court with attorney Alysja Otten.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Otten stands mute.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture proceedings.   Court grants request.  Warrant authorized (Sawyer and Surrounding Counties) as requested and bail forfeiture to begin.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
